newsitem.title: USA: Muni yields mostly flat over past week - Delphis.
newsitem.headline: Muni yields mostly flat over past week - Delphis.

text.p: Municipal bond yields were flat to five basis points higher in the week ended Thursday, Delphis Hanover Corp said on Friday.
Thirty-year, Aaa-rated municipal yields were unchanged at 5.60 percent, while thirty-year Baa yields rose five basis points to 6.40 percent.
The mostly flat municipal market matched Treasury trends, where the long bond rose five basis points over the week to finish at 6.89 percent.
In the intermediate sector of the municipal market, ten-year Aaa-rated muni yields were unchanged for the week at 4.95 percent, and Baa-rated 10-years were flat at 5.75 percent.
Average yields on one-year Aaa-rated municipal bonds were unchanged across the credit spectrum, holding at 3.70 percent for Aaa-rated bonds and 4.50 percent for Baa's.

The Aaa municipal yield curve was unchanged for the second week in a row at 190 basis points. The spread between one-year and 30-year Baa's widened five basis points for the second week in a row, moving to 190 basis points.

The credit spread between Aaa-rated and Baa-rated one-years was unchanged for the second consecutive week at 80 basis points, and the 30-year spread widened for the second week in a row to 80 basis points.
